info.description:
API definition for eRS

 | API Documentation |
 |-----|
  |[e-Referral Service - FHIR API](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir)|


 | FHIR Implementation Guide | Version |
 |-----|-----|
 |[ukcore.release1.test](https://simplifier.net/guide/hl7fhirukcorer4release1/home)||
 |[uk.nhsdigital.r4.test](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home)||

tags.name: Appointment
tags.description:
A booking of a healthcare event among patient(s), practitioner(s), related person(s) and/or device(s) for a specific date/time. This may result in one or more Encounter(s).

 Profile (constraints): [England-Appointment](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/England-Appointment.guide.md)

tags.name: ServiceRequest
tags.description:
A record of a request for service such as diagnostic investigations, treatments, or operations to be performed.

 Profile (constraints): [England-ServiceRequest](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/England-ServiceRequest.guide.md)

tags.name: Task
tags.description:
A task to be performed.

 Profile (constraints): [NHSDigital-Task](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/NHSDigital-Task.guide.md)

tags.name: Slot
tags.description:
A slot of time on a schedule that may be available for booking appointments.

 Profile (constraints): [England-Slot](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/England-Slot.guide.md)

tags.name: QuestionnaireResponse
tags.description:
A structured set of questions and their answers. The questions are ordered and grouped into coherent subsets, corresponding to the structure of the grouping of the questionnaire being responded to.

 To support structured, hierarchical reporting of data gathered using digital forms and other questionnaires.

 Profile (constraints): [NHSDigital-QuestionnaireResponse](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/NHSDigital-QuestionnaireResponse.guide.md)

tags.name: HealthcareService
tags.description:
The details of a healthcare service available at a location.

 Profile (constraints): [NHSDigital-HealthcareService](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/NHSDigital-HealthcareService.guide.md)

tags.name: DocumentReference
tags.description:
A reference to a document of any kind for any purpose. Provides metadata about the document so that the document can be discovered and managed. The scope of a document is any seralized object with a mime-type, so includes formal patient centric documents (CDA), cliical notes, scanned paper, and non-patient specific documents like policy text.

 Profile (constraints): [England-DocumentReference](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/England-DocumentReference.guide.md)

tags.name: Binary
tags.description:
A resource that represents the data of a single raw artifact as digital content accessible in its native format.  A Binary resource can contain any content, whether text, image, pdf, zip archive, etc.

 There are situations where it is useful or required to handle pure binary content using the same framework as other resources.

 Profile (constraints): [NHSDigital-Binary](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/NHSDigital-Binary.guide.md)

get.description:
[search](http://www.hl7.org/fhir/search.html) for Appointment instances.

Mock for NHS App Wayfinder project

parameters.name: patient:identifier
parameters.description:
Search for appointment for a patient by NHS Number

 | Name | Type |  Expression | 
 |--------|--------|--------| 
 | patient | [token ](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/search.html#token)|  Appointment.participant.actor.identifier |

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
Appointment date/time.

 | Name | Type |  Expression | 
 |--------|--------|--------| 
 | date | [date/datetime ](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/search.html#date/datetime)|  Appointment.start |

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
An [OAuth 2.0 bearer token](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/guides-and-documentation/security-and-authorisation#user-restricted-apis).

Required in all environments except sandbox.

parameters.name: NHSD-Session-URID
parameters.description: The user role ID (URID) for the current session. Also known as a user role profile ID (URPID).

parameters.name: X-Request-ID
parameters.description: A globally unique identifier (GUID) for the request, which we use to de-duplicate repeated requests and to trace the request if you contact our helpdesk

parameters.name: X-Correlation-ID
parameters.description: An optional ID which you can use to track transactions across multiple systems. It can have any value, but we recommend avoiding `.` characters.

Initial Advice Creation (A+G Scenario On.description: code should be a child concept of Evaluation procedure code (SNOMED CT 386053000)?. The advice and guidance referral is created along with a corresponding worklist (FHIR Task) item. These are retrieved via the [GET /Task](#/Task/get_Task) API and responses are sent via the [PUT /Task](#/Task/put_Task) API.

Create Referral (A+G Scenario Five).description:
code should be a child concept of Patient Referral procedure code (SNOMED CT 3457005)? 

 Following from the advice and guidnace workflow completing, it has been decided to refer the patient to a service. Note the use of basedOn to reference the original advice and guidance request.

Initial Referral Creation (Triage Scenar.description: Note: the status is set to `draft` until this referral is triaged this can not be acted upon. To create the actual defferal see [POST /Task](#/Task/post_Task)

put.description:
[update](http://www.hl7.org/fhir/http.html#update) an existing Task instance, or create using a client-assigned ID.

See also [A013 - Accept referral](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir#api-Default-a013-accept-referral) and [A014 - Reject referral](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir#api-Default-a014-reject-referral)

Responding to Advice (A+G Scenario Two).description: A user (sds-user-id=0987654321) responds to the worklist item. A document can be attached to the ServiceRequest and Task by using the [POST /Binary](#/Binary/post_Binary) POST / and [POST /DocumentReference](#/DocumentReference/post_DocumentReference) endpoints.

Requesting additional advice, increasing.summary: Requesting additional advice, increasing priority (A+G Scenario Three)
Requesting additional advice, increasing.description: The Task.priority is increased to urgent. The use of PATCH /Task can also be considered as an alternative for this interaction.

Provider converts advice request (A+G Sc.summary: Provider converts advice request (A+G Scenario Four and Six)
Provider converts advice request (A+G Sc.description: The Task.status is completed. See [POST /ServiceRequest](#/ServiceRequest/post_ServiceRequest) for the new referral (scenario Five)

Reviewing a Triage Deferral (Triage Scen.summary: Reviewing a Triage Deferral (Triage Scenario Three)
Reviewing a Triage Deferral (Triage Scen.description: Task.status set to completed. Review advice linked in Task.output. Next actions to mark as to book or create an Appointment [POST /Appointment](#/Appointment/post_Appointment)

get.description:
[search](http://www.hl7.org/fhir/search.html) for Task instances.

See also [A008 - Retrieve referral worklist](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/e-referral-service-fhir#api-Default-a008-retrieve-worklist)

 | Name | Type |  Expression | 
 |--------|--------|--------| 
 | schedule | [reference ](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/search.html#reference)|  Slot.schedule | 
| actor | [reference ](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/search.html#reference)|  Schedule.actor.where(resolve() is HealthcareService) |
